alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Johnson; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 8:36PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Martin, southeastern Johnson, northern Floyd and northwestern Pike Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 836 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Oaklawn Estates, or near Paintsville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Odds, Corn Fork Hollow and Lancer around 845 PM EDT. Dicks Creek around 850 PM EDT. Endicott and Davisport around 855 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Pleasant, Moree, Prince, Davella, McClure, McCombs, Delong, Preece, Pevier and Debord. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 3 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 4. Kentucky Highway 3 in Johnson County Kentucky Highway 3 in Martin County between mile markers 1 and 8. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 16 and 21. U.S. Highway 23 in Johnson County between mile markers 0 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
